channel.title: Comments on: Toughest SQL Challenges
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: I totally agree, although in this case I didn't have the joy of being the one to screw up (I get plenty of other chances to do that, luckily they usually aren't nearly this catastrophic ;) )
item.content:encoded: I totally agree, although in this case I didn’t have the joy of being the one to screw up (I get plenty of other chances to do that, luckily they usually aren’t nearly this catastrophic ðŸ˜‰ )

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I always say the best way to learn is to screw up something, no pain no gain!!!!
Once you drop a production table or delete data by forgetting to highlight the WHERE clause you will never do it again after you get dozens of people asking when it will be fixed
